The base rate for Berkshire changing a long-held position in any given quarter is low. Since the status quo of no change results in a 'No' outcome, this is the most probable result. My forecast is not higher because of the powerful counter-signal from the multi-year holding pattern. To change this long-standing holding, there would likely need to be a significant change in valuation or business outlook. Without evidence of such a catalyst in Q1 2025, a purchase remains unlikely.

I would increase my forecast if I learned that Amazon's stock had a significant, unjustified price drop during Q1 2025. I would decrease my forecast if public statements from Berkshire's leadership in early 2025 had indicated a bearish sentiment on large-cap technology valuations.
